titleInfo.title: Montage of Elias Cohen and Family of Aspen, Colorado

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 10 x 8 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: On envelope: ''Elias Cohen family of Aspen, 1905''. Note inside envelope: ''#52 Elias Cohen family - supervisor of mines in Aspen in Aspen, with his wife and children and his wife's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Weinberg Aspen 1905 (Mrs. Elias Cohen, nee Weinberg) donated by Mrs. Regina Collins''.

mods.abstract: Collage of the Elias Cohen family of Aspen including a formal portrait of Elias Cohen (bottom left); a formal portrait of his wife and two daughters (bottom right); and formal portraits of his in-laws, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Weinberg (top). Elias Cohen was a resident of Aspen by 1891, a mine supervisor in, and manager of David Hyman's properties. It was Cohen who suggested the use of deep-sea divers to repair broken mine-pump shafts.
mods.note: Appears in ''Images of America: Jewish Denver 1859-1940,'' by Dr. Jeanne Abrams, on page 120.

titleInfo.title: Beck Archives Photograph Collection, Families and Groups
